page.title: 17FAMOUS INHABITANTS
page.content: Famous inhabitants of the area. Bruce Bairnsfather was a cartoonist who was famous because he drew pictures for magazines.There are cartoons in Northchapel Club and in the Village Hall.He lived in Barns Close,Northchapel.This used to be the old forge workshops.When Bairnsfather moved into Northchapel he bought these workshops and converted them into a house which he called Barns Close.This property has just been sold for Â£80,000. Sir Arthur Wing Pinero died in 1934 and was buried in Northchapel Churchyard aged 89.He began his career as an actor and later became a famous playwrite. Noah Mann was a famous cricketer who ran the Half Moon Public House. Alfred Lord Tennyson lived at one time at Aldworth House on Blackdown.
